title: Madelung's Disease: Etiology, Demographics, and Diagnosis
short_description: Clinical overview of Madelung's disease covering its unknown etiology, demographic patterns, and diagnostic approaches.
long_description: This document provides a comprehensive clinical overview of Madelung's disease, a rare disorder characterized by abnormal fat metabolism. The content discusses the unknown etiology of the condition, noting its potential classification as an endocrine disorder and possible genetic predisposition with familial clustering. The document details the demographic characteristics of affected patients, highlighting the predominance in middle-aged males with alcohol abuse history, while noting occurrence in women and non-alcohol users. Geographic prevalence patterns showing higher rates in Europe compared to the United States are addressed, along with diagnostic imaging modalities including ultrasound, CT scans, and MRI used for clinical evaluation.
